alert.note: Alert for Dodge; Fillmore; Mower; Olmsted (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS LaCrosse (Southwestern Wisconsin, Southeastern Minnesota, and Northeast Iowa)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued December 08 at 8:12PM CST until December 09 at 12:00PM CST by NWS LaCrosse
info.description: .OVERVIEW...A band of snow can be seen on radar across central Iowa this evening and will continue to spread across northeast Iowa and southeast Minnesota this evening. This band of snow is expected to reach US 218 around 10 PM tonight, US 63 around 11 PM and US 52 around midnight. Further to the east, snow will reach the Interstate 94 corridor early Friday morning. Freezing drizzle is still expected to spread across the area as the snow comes to an end Friday morning. Light ice accumulations are possible, but impacts are expected to be limited as the drizzle falls on a fresh snowpack. ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON CST FRIDAY... * WHAT...Snow, heavy at times, followed by freezing drizzle Friday morning. Total snow accumulations of 3 to 5 inches, locally up to 6 inches possible in northeast Iowa. Ice accumulations of a light glaze. * WHERE...Portions of north central and northeast Iowa and southeast Minnesota. * WHEN...Until noon CST Friday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. The hazardous conditions will impact the morning commute. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Freezing drizzle is expected to spread across the area behind the snowfall. With snow already on the ground impacts will be limited, but slippery stretches could develop on untreated surfaces.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
